statement.text: Planck entropy is the fundamental unit of entropy in natural units, equal to the Boltzmann constant k_B. It represents the entropy associated with one nat (natural unit) of information, or approximately 1.44 bits. In the Bekenstein-Hawking formula, black hole entropy is measured in units of k_B, with one bit of information per 4 Planck areas.

explanation.intuition: Just as Planck angular momentum equals ℏ exactly, Planck entropy equals k_B exactly. Boltzmann's constant links temperature to energy: each degree Kelvin corresponds to k_B joules of thermal energy per particle. In information theory, k_B relates physical entropy to information content: S = k_B · ln(W) where W is the number of microstates.
explanation.key_insight: Planck entropy k_B is the bridge between thermodynamics and information theory. The Bekenstein-Hawking formula S_BH = k_B·A/(4ℓ_P²) shows that one nat (~1.44 bits) of information requires 4 Planck areas of black hole horizon. This is the maximum information density in nature - the holographic bound. Since 2019, k_B is exact by SI definition, making S_P a precisely defined quantity.
explanation.technical_details: Planck entropy S_P = k_B = 1.380649 × 10⁻²³ J/K (exact since 2019 SI redefinition). Dimensions: [S_P] = [energy/temperature] = J/K. Entropy quantization in black holes: S_BH = k_B·A/(4ℓ_P²) = (k_B/4) × (number of Planck areas). Boltzmann's formula: S = k_B·ln(W). Information content: 1 nat = 1 k_B of entropy ≈ 1.443 bits. The Bekenstein bound: S ≤ 2πk_B·RE/(ℏc) limits entropy of any system. Planck entropy is NOT a minimum - black holes can have entropy of many k_B units.
common_misconceptions: Planck entropy is derived from other Planck units - FALSE: S_P = k_B exactly by definition
There's a minimum entropy - FALSE: ground states have S = 0 at T = 0 K (third law)
Entropy is always measured in bits - FALSE: physical entropy in J/K, information entropy in bits
k_B is measured - FALSE: since 2019, k_B is exact by SI definition
Every Planck area contains exactly 1 bit - FALSE: it's 4 Planck areas per bit (BH entropy)

definitions_glossary.planck_entropy: S_P = k_B = 1.380649 × 10⁻²³ J/K, the natural unit of entropy
definitions_glossary.boltzmann_constant: k_B, links temperature to energy; S_P = k_B by definition
definitions_glossary.nat: Natural unit of information = ln(e) = 1; entropy S = 1 nat when W = e microstates
definitions_glossary.bit: Binary unit of information = ln(2); 1 nat ≈ 1.443 bits
definitions_glossary.boltzmann_formula: S = k_B·ln(W), entropy from number of microstates W
definitions_glossary.bekenstein_hawking_entropy: S_BH = k_B·A/(4ℓ_P²), black hole entropy proportional to area
definitions_glossary.bekenstein_bound: S ≤ 2πk_B·RE/(ℏc), maximum entropy in spherical region
definitions_glossary.holographic_bound: S ≤ k_B·A/(4ℓ_P²), maximum entropy bounded by surface area

exact_value_details.note: S_P = k_B exactly - same constant, no derivation needed

information_equivalence.nat: 1 k_B = 1 nat of information (natural logarithm base)

definition.@value: The fundamental unit of entropy S_P = k_B = 1.380649 × 10⁻²³ J/K (exact), which is simply the Boltzmann constant itself
